Description: Ostracon, large section (five fragments joined) of the body of a light-brown pottery vessel, the fabric is partially grey in section, the exterior, grooved in a number of places and with two lines of cord-marked decoration, is covered with a red-brown slip and remains of fourteen lines of Coptic text written in black ink, consisting of a contract for work and wages.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.134-135)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (87648) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/87648)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 164 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
